> [{quoted}](name=CaptainMårvelous,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=7buuXYju,comment-id=0004000000000000,timestamp=2018-02-04T01:59:01.518+0000)

> Not that anyone will believe me.

I believe you, because flex was my highest rank for quite awhile, and I played solo as well. I'm not one of those "flex doesn't count" assholes. In the middle of last season for some reason I just found people were way more willing to work as a team to win, rather than the ME ME ME of solo q's and as a support main, that was a much better environment, till toward the end the season when the "Oh it doesn't matter its just flex" douchebags showed up in more and more numbers.
This may work in high elo, in low elo nobody knows a shit.
A statement in the spirit of Captain Jack Sparrow ^^

i am a new chick to gaming my husband games all the time and tired of fighting so i decided to start gaming and now I'm hooked but i hate losing!!! Fingers not fast enough and make stupid decisions but i do want to place higher than him cause i am so competitive and words of advice for me to get better? i watch you tube to play certain characters but it doesnt help me out i have to do it at the same time.  Any advice is helpful :)

For starters, learn to CS. Farming minions is one of the most important mechanics of the game. Each champion does different amounts of damage, so soon enough you'll learn how much damage you need to kill a creep.

Wave manipulation is important too, but idk if you're ready for that or not. Even if you play jungle or support, you need to learn wave manipulation. A REALLY important mechanic in League. Can't stress that enough. You need to be able to control the flow of the lane, not react to it. Or know how your TEAMMATES are controlling it, so you can act accordingly (for example ganks when teammate freezes a lane at a certain point).
not to mention if u die once, the game is over  this game sucks for that
Watching replays from the enemies' perspective is pretty helpful in seeing your own mistakes so you can fix them.

For mechanics, all you can do is practice. Keep playing games and you will get better over time. If you want to get better at one specific thing like kiting or a specific combo on your champion, you can do that in a custom or a training mode.

As for game knowledge, keep watching videos, read guides and watch streams. Decision making will eventually become almost natural.

pick one champion in one role and learn that, then learn the game as a whole while playing the same champion so you're not constantly re-learning the basics

(except bot lane)

Bot lane is degenerate garbage and 'maining' support or adc will never help you learn the rest of the game as a beginner. The only exception is if you have a consistent duo partner to play the lane with.

> [{quoted}](name=AtomicLovey,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=7buuXYju,comment-id=0007,timestamp=2018-02-03T23:48:35.012+0000)

Fingers not fast enough and make stupid decisions but i do want to place higher than him cause i am so competitive and words of advice for me to get better? i watch you tube to play certain characters but it doesnt help me out i have to do it at the same time.  Any advice is helpful :)

Play a champion that has wonky skillshots and mechanics, then transfer those superb skills at landing skillshots from {{champion:432}} to {{champion:103}} Play the champions like {{champion:266}} {{champion:82}} to learn how to abuse metaslaves.

> [{quoted}](name=AtomicLovey,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=7buuXYju,comment-id=0007,timestamp=2018-02-03T23:48:35.012+0000)
>
> i am a new chick to gaming my husband games all the time and tired of fighting so i decided to start gaming and now I'm hooked but i hate losing!!! Fingers not fast enough and make stupid decisions but i do want to place higher than him cause i am so competitive and words of advice for me to get better? i watch you tube to play certain characters but it doesnt help me out i have to do it at the same time.  Any advice is helpful :)

I think i can help. first, you have to play a variety of champs to get the basic feel of the game ( try to find the ones you like best) and learn things like auto attack resets, jungle paths, and before long for the most trivial things your instincts will kick in and you can focus on other things.  if you want to main jungle, i highly suggest watching Virkayu.  ( I do play a lot of champs though, so if you're interested in any ones reply and ill see if i can help!)

Mechanics are just things you will learn over time, but honestly, and this sounds like shit talking, but just don't feed, I have been autofilled to lanes I do not regularly play, and as long as I just focus on not feeding, we do well lol, and use the frickin trinkets lol vision is a beautiful thing, and literally everyone on the team should buy at least 1 control ward at some point, if only to guard your back

I got stuck in bronze last season from 8 trolls and 2 afks in my placements. I don't know if any of them are banned. I think there were 2 remakes too, or was that last season?

Trying to play support, but 2 trolls in 4 placements so far...
S6 I got s5, and I was doing pretty well.
Bronze is toxic and people feed so much, to the extent where you can't carry with 50/5. It's hard to 1v5, even if you're fed (unless you're, for example, yi, or rengar, or kha zix, or someone with invisibility that can walk up and one shot every single person... Zoe can too)

This is the rationale behind most of my baron calls.

1. I don't think we can do Baron right now.
2. Do they also think that?
3. Is Baron warded?
4. Fuck it, Nunu take the blast cone we're doing Baron.
he's right,am i right,or am i right?
